intro: Uragoga capillacea, commonly known as the slender hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in wetland or marshy environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, a common feature among grasses. Uragoga capillacea plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
